content.description: Start in the left center of the east face of the Crypt below an obvious right leaning crack system. Climb past a low bulge (the rock is a bit suspect here) to gain the obvious crack system. Follow the crack up and right to the top.
content.protection: Carry a good selection of medium sized gear. Move about 15 feet down and left from the top of the route and rappel with one rope.
content.location: Start in the left center of the east face of the Crypt below an obvious right leaning crack system. This is about 35 feet left of Tomb Raiders.

content.description: Tomb Raiders is located in the center of the southeast face of The Crypt. The crux is the powerful bulge to a mantle at the first bolt. Step right from the second bolt to 5.10 slab moves up to a ledge separated from the main wall by a gap. The third bolt protects the height-dependent span across the gap (6 foot tall or jump!) to jugs and another mantle, then 5.8 slab past the 4th bolt up to the lower-off anchor. Maybe two out of five stars.
content.protection: I placed a #3 camalot in the horizontal crack on the left before the first bolt, then 4 bolts to a 2-bolt lower-off anchor. 70 Feet.

content.description: Climbs the varnished buttress on the right side of the southeast face. This is the easiest way up the buttress. Begin by climbing to the first bolt of Serf City, then move up and left, over a bulge, then up the center of the face.
content.protection: Thin to 2 inches, one bolt. 2-bolt belay/rap anchor. 60 feet.

content.description: Climbs the right side of the varnished buttress. (right side of the southeast face of the Crypt) Begin by stemming up a groove then climb the face past 3 bolts. 2-bolt belay/rap anchor. 60 feet. Maybe one star out of five for the nice patina on the upper half of the route.
content.protection: I used a medium nut between the first and second bolts.

content.description:
At the northern side of the west face of The Crypt is a left leaning ramp/corner. Climb the ramp/corner to the top (V1; 25 feet) then go 15 feet up a low angled slab to a wide crack. Climb the wide crack to the top (V2).

V1: Start about eight feet down and left of the ramp/corner. Climb a short crack system to the top of the ramp/corner (5.7)

V2: Climb the sculptured and unprotected face to the right of the wide crack (5.3 X).
content.protection: Tiny cams or smallish wires protect the initial corner, a medium or huge cam somewhat protects the upper crack. Rappel with one rope.
content.location: At the northern side of the west face of The Crypt is a left leaning ramp/corner. This corner is behind some boulders that are at the base of the face.

climbs.name: The Mummy's Curse
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Randy Ziedberg, Glynn & Sue Thomas 11-2012

content.description: Climb the obvious gully/chimney to the left of Mummy Dearest. This is the right of two obvious chimney systems on the east face of the formation.
content.protection: Carry gear up to a blue Camalot. Rappel with one rope from the anchor atop Serf's Up.
content.location: The obvious gully/chimney to the left of Mummy Dearest.

content.description: Climbs the left side of the plated/varnished buttress, located on the right side of the southeast face.Climbs up to the slanting wide crack, then up the varnished face with seams. Maybe one out of five stars.
content.protection: Thin to 3.5 inches. 2-bolt belay/rap anchor 60 feet.

content.description: Climb up the first 20 feet of The Mummy's Curse, then move slightly left and climb the arete and face just to the left of The Mummy's Curse chimney.
content.protection: Carry small to medium gear. Rappel with one rope.
content.location: Start at the base of the obvious, right-most chimney on the east face of the Crypt (the chimney is the line of The Mummy's Curse).
